edu.stanford.cs.pptx.code

Class PPWord

  • Object
    • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.PPShape
      • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.PPGroup
        • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.code.PPWord

  • public class PPWord
extends PPGroup
    This class represents a word in a memory viewer.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double DEFAULT_HEIGHT 
      static double DEFAULT_WIDTH

      Returns a new PPWord object with the specified dimensions.

      • PPWord

        public PPWord(double width,
              double height)
        Returns a new PPWord object with the specified dimensions.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the word in pixels
        height - The height of the word in pixels

    • Method Detail

      • setLabel

        public void setLabel(String label)
        Assigns a label to the word. The position of the label is controlled by the setLabelOrientation method.
        Parameters:
        label - The label assigned to the word

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel()
        Returns the label assigned to this word.
        Returns:
        The label assigned to this word

      • setAddress

        public void setAddress(int addr)
        Sets the address of the word.
        Parameters:
        addr - The address of the word

      • getAddress

        public int getAddress()
        Returns the address of the word. If no address has been assigned, getAddress returns -1.
        Returns:
        The address of the word

      • set

        public void set(Object value)
        Sets the value assigned to this word.
        Parameters:
        value - The value assigned to this word

      • set

        public void set(Object value,
                String options)
        Sets the value assigned to this word. This version allows the client to change the animation options.
        Parameters:
        value - The value assigned to this word
        options - The animation options

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Erases the value of this variable from the display.

      • setFillColor

        public void setFillColor(Color color)
        Sets the fill color of the word.
        Parameters:
        color - The fill color

      • setFont

        public void setFont(Font font)
        Sets the font for the value assigned to this word.
        Parameters:
        font - The font for the value

      • setFont

        public void setFont(String str)
        Sets the font for the value. In this version of setFont, the font is expressed as a string in the form 
            "family-style-size"
        Parameters:
        str - A string representing the font

      • getFont

        public Font getFont()
        Gets the value font.
        Returns:
        The font used to display the value

      • setLabelFont

        public void setLabelFont(Font font)
        Sets the font for the label.
        Parameters:
        font - The font for the label

      • setLabelFont

        public void setLabelFont(String str)
        Sets the font for the label. In this version of setLabelFont, the font is expressed as a string in the form 
            "family-style-size"
        Parameters:
        str - A string representing the font

      • getLabelFont

        public Font getLabelFont()
        Gets the label font.
        Returns:
        The font used to display the label

      • setAddressFont

        public void setAddressFont(Font font)
        Sets the font for the address.
        Parameters:
        font - The font for the address

      • setAddressFont

        public void setAddressFont(String str)
        Sets the font for the address. In this version of setAddressFont, the font is expressed as a string in the form 
            "family-style-size"
        Parameters:
        str - A string representing the font

      • getAddressFont

        public Font getAddressFont()
        Gets the address font.
        Returns:
        The font used to display the address

      • setLabelOrientation

        public void setLabelOrientation(String str)
        Sets the format for the labels attached to the word. The parameter is a string consisting of the literal words "address" and "label" separated by a hyphen, if both appear. The field to the left of the hyphen appears on the left side of the variable box and the field to the right of the hyphen (or a field alone on the line) appears to right of the variable box.
        Parameters:
        str - The orientation string

      • getLabelOrientation

        public String getLabelOrientation()
        Gets the format for the labels attached to the word.
        Returns:
        The orientation string

      • getWordWidth

        public double getWordWidth()
        Returns the width of the word box. Note that getWidth returns the width of the group, which may be different.
        Returns:
        The width of the word box

      • getWordHeight

        public double getWordHeight()
        Returns the height of the word box. Note that getHeight returns the height of the group, which may be different.
        Returns:
        The height of the word box

      • getCenter

        public Point2D getCenter()
        Returns the center of the word box.
        Overrides:
        getCenter in class PPShape
        Returns:
        The center of the word box
